summary: This is an email chain from January 6, 2020, between FBI agents and a U.S. Embassy official in Stockholm, discussing the need to coordinate with Swedish authorities before contacting a potential witness in Sweden related to the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell investigation. The case agent from the FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force seeks to set up an interview with the witness.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject in an FBI investigation regarding child exploitation and human trafficking.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject alongside Jeffrey Epstein in the same FBI investigation.

persons.name: Alaimo
persons.context: Copied into the email chain to be brought up to speed on the particulars regarding a witness in Sweden.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects in the same FBI investigation into child exploitation and human trafficking.

events.title: FBI coordination for witness interview in Sweden
events.description: FBI agents in New York and Copenhagen coordinate via email with the U.S. Embassy in Stockholm to ensure proper channels are followed before contacting a witness in Sweden related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell for child exploitation and human trafficking as of January 2020.
The investigation involved a witness located in Sweden whom the FBI sought to interview.
The FBI case agent was based in New York and part of the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force.
The FBI Legat in Copenhagen had authority over Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Iceland, requiring coordination for international witness contact.
Standard protocol required notifying Swedish counterparts prior to conducting any interview with a witness in Sweden.
